alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 6:02AM MST until January 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for elevations above 7500 feet ASL and 1 to 3 inches above 6000 feet. Wind gusts up to 45 mph over mountain passes and ridges. * WHERE...Southern Gila Highlands/Black Range and Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet. * WHEN...Through 8 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially for the morning commute. Gusty winds combined with falling snow will result in blowing snow and reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will be heaviest in the Sacramento Mountains late this morning, with light snow this evening and tonight. Minor accumulations possible in Silver City and the Sacramento Mountains slopes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range
